lipid stats & figure s3
Elise & Artemis Keister analysed lipid content of breviolum cultures. visualize total lipids per samples.
```{r}
# set the working directory
setwd("~/Desktop/PhD/summer 2018/culture_lipids/")

# load packages
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(reshape2)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggpubr)
library(cowplot)
library(PMCMR)

# read in the data
tot <- read_excel("~/Desktop/PhD/summer 2018/culture_lipids/HR_cultures_lipid quant.xlsx", sheet = "for_R_total")
tot <- as.data.frame(tot)

# color palette
cols <-c( "26" = "#0072B2", "28" = "#999999", "30" = "#D55E00")

# make ironconc and temp factors
tot$Temp <- as.factor(tot$Temp)
tot$Ironconc <- as.factor(tot$Ironconc)
tot$Species <- as.factor(tot$Species)
tot$treatment_ID <- as.factor(tot$treatment_ID)

# make levels fancy
tot$Species <- factor(tot$Species, levels = c("min", "psyg"))
levels(tot$Species) <- c("B. minutum", "B. psygmophilum")
tot$Ironconc <- factor(tot$Ironconc, levels =c("100", "50", "10"))
levels(tot$Ironconc) <- c("500 pM Fe'", "250 pM Fe'", "50 pM Fe'")

# figure s3
## update to have the two species on the same row!
# this is the one used for the manuscript!
tot2 <- ggplot(data=tot, aes(x=Ironconc, y=total_lipid_no_outlier, fill=Species, color=Species)) +
  geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.5, aes(colour = factor(Species)), varwidth = FALSE, position = position_dodge(1, preserve = "single")) +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(y="Total lipid (mg/cell)", x=element_blank(), title = element_blank()) +
  theme(panel.grid = element_blank(),
        strip.text.x = element_text(face = "bold"),
        strip.text.y = element_text(face = "bold.italic"),
        legend.title = element_text(face = "bold"),
        legend.text = element_text(face = "italic"),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle=20, vjust=1, hjust=1),
        axis.title = element_text(face = "bold"),
        legend.position = "bottom") +
  facet_grid(~Temp, scales = "fixed") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("grey", "black"), breaks = c("B. minutum", "B. psygmophilum"), name = "Species") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("grey", "black"), breaks = c("B. minutum", "B. psygmophilum"), name = "Species")
tot2

save_plot("lipid_cell_v2.pdf", tot2, base_aspect_ratio = 1.9)

### do the total lipid stats.

# between species
kruskal.test(tot$total_lipid, tot$Species)

# within species
bm <- dplyr::filter(tot, Species %in% c("B. minutum"))
bp <- dplyr::filter(tot, Species %in% c("B. psygmophilum"))

# normality tests
shapiro.test(bm$total_lipid)
shapiro.test(bp$total_lipid)

# KW test
kruskal.test(bm$total_lipid, bm$Temp)
kruskal.test(bm$total_lipid, bm$Ironconc)
kruskal.test(bp$total_lipid, bp$Temp)
kruskal.test(bp$total_lipid, bp$Ironconc)

# post hoc by iron
posthoc.kruskal.dunn.test(total_lipid~Ironconc, data = bm, p.adjust.methods = "fdr")
posthoc.kruskal.dunn.test(total_lipid~Ironconc, data = bp, p.adjust.methods = "fdr")

# post hoc by temp
posthoc.kruskal.dunn.test(total_lipid~Temp, data = bm, p.adjust.methods = "fdr")
posthoc.kruskal.dunn.test(total_lipid~Temp, data = bp, p.adjust.methods = "fdr")

# post hoc by treatment ID
posthoc.kruskal.dunn.test(total_lipid~treatment_ID, data = bm, p.adjust.methods = "fdr")
posthoc.kruskal.dunn.test(total_lipid~treatment_ID, data = bp, p.adjust.methods = "fdr")

```
